author: Special Correspondent
text:
TO BEAT THE HEAT:Deputy Commissioner of Police (Law and Order) Bandi Gangadhar distributing lemon juice to traffic police personnel at Goripalayam junction in Madurai on Sunday; (right) Deputy Superintendent of Police S. Ramakrishnan distributing the juice in Usilampatti.— Photo: R. Ashok

TO BEAT THE HEAT:Deputy Commissioner of Police (Law and Order) Bandi Gangadhar distributing lemon juice to traffic police personnel at Goripalayam junction in Madurai on Sunday; (right) Deputy Superintendent of Police S. Ramakrishnan distributing the juice in Usilampatti.— Photo: R. Ashok

With the temperature shooting up in the recent days, the city and district police began distribution of lemon juice and buttermilk to police personnel manning traffic signals under a hot sun from Sunday.

Deputy Commissioner of Police, Law and Order, Bandi Gangadhar, started the exercise at the Goripalayam junction. A total of 350 traffic police personnel, from constables to Assistant Commissioners of Police, would be given the juice or buttermilk at their work spot to help them beat fatigue under the energy-sapping hot conditions.

It would be served at 11 a.m. and 3 p.m.

Superintendent of Police Vijayendra Bidari said that 81 police personnel in nine traffic police stations would be given the juice and buttermilk. The distribution would continue throughout the summer.
title: Traffic police get juice, buttermilk
